item.title: Report X-2023080707
item.description:
Report X-2023080707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming down the NC line and as the package handler pulled it off the belt to place onto a cart they noticed it leaking at the bottom. They informed their manager whom placed the container into a hazmat bin so it could be transported to the hazmat cage, where it was inspected by the hazmat team and placed into a yellow hazmat drum under ventilation. DescribePack: at the bottom of the near corner of the container there is a small slit that is leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a lined hazmat bin and brought to the hazmat cage where it was inspected and placed in a yellow hazmat drum under ventilation then sealed.

It was wet on the top and I took it down to our hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on. DescribePack: 4 cans were bent and dented with one having a hole in it and it was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought it down to the hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on.

item.title: Report X-2023081811
item.description:
Report X-2023081811

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was found in unload completely soaked. I grabbed a can of quick dry and dumped it all over the wet spots, cleaned up with a broom and dust pan, put all the waste into hazmat bags and brought them down to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The one jug had a loose cap and was completely off he jug. The jug was empty and was all over the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I put quick dry all over the floor to soak up all the wet areas and swept it up into a hazmat bag.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 20 gallon drums of clax sonril (un2014) had been punctured by a sharp object and had released 8 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080511
item.description:
Report E-2023080511

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/17/2023 a Veolia employee was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility. During the process, the employee punctured a 55-gallon steel drum with the drum cart while placing it in an outbound trailer. The employee was moving the drums into the trailer and misjudged the distance to the drum piercing it with the forks of the drum cart and caused a leak from the drum. About a gallon of liquid leaked out of the impacted drum. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued without further incident. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee noticed the accident right away.

item.title: Report E-2023080510
item.description:
Report E-2023080510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: KENMORE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/18/2023 a Veolia employee from the Kenmore, NY office was loading drums from a truck into a trailer at the Veolia, Kenmore, NY 10 day intransit facility. The leak occurred when the employee was moving the drums into the outbound trailer and the employee noticed that the drums were very old and liquid was coming out of two of them. The drums were only supposed to contain solid material. It is assumed that a small amount of liquid got into the drums prior to pick up and they leaked when being transported from the pick up at the customer's site in Clay NY to the Veolia's office in Kenmore, NY. Less than a liter of liquid leaked out of both of the drums. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drums were overpacked into 85 gallon salvage drums, the spill was cleaned up, and the drums were transported to the ultimate disposal facility without further incident. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee noticed the leak right away.

item.title: Report I-2023070018
item.description:
Report I-2023070018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: ORISKANY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HILLTOP ENERGY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/24/2023 while on a return trip from Heidelberg Materials in Jordanville, O'brien Brickey was traveling west on Rt. 5S toward Utica. As he crossed over a bridge he noticed material white in color coming out of the back of the truck (270). O'Brien pulled over immediately to check out the truck upon doing so noticed there was emulsion flowing out from what appeared to be several places. O'Brien immediately called his supervisor Derrick Paro who instructed him to call PERS and also NY DEC was notified. O'Brien was told by PERS that appropriate personnel would be dispatched for cleanup. The site was cleaned up and there is nothing further at this time.
